title: Synchronice
author: Synchronice
content: I was just viewing default trust members on Bitcointalk and suddenly I discovered one ex member called Zepher, he has passed away, RIP. Then I discovered another member called Blazed. As I see, you guys tag people with high trust rating, those who left the forum and those who passed away. When I checked Blazed's profile, it seems he is still in DT list but October 27, 2020 is the last time he was active. When I viewed his profile, he has never mentioned that he left the forum, also, when I saw his trust rating, he didn't have any trust tag that would mention that he has passed out or is not active anymore.As it seems, he was one of the most active and trusted member of this forum, I have no idea why the fact that he left the forum went unnoticed. Has anyone any idea how is he doing? Is he alive and doing well? Just wondering.

comments.author: hg_away
comments.body: you can ask about him on Collectibles, may find someone who has information about him, and I hope he is in good health, as he was one of the active members.As for the reason for the inactivity, it may beQuote from: Blazed on June 12, 2019, 10:03:50 PMAgreed, Theymos is not a regular user at all. I decided to just remove my entire list and get removed from this whole DT disaster moving forward. The never ending drama of this stuff has gotten old and just ignoring it all makes life easier.it is better to let people live their lives.Quoteit seems he is still in DT list but October 27, 2020 is the last time he was active.It is not surprising that he is a DT. I have added a number of inactive people to my trust list because them feedback is worth reading and I think everyone does that.

comments.author: skarais
comments.body: Quote from: Synchronice on September 07, 2023, 03:07:00 PMAs it seems, he was one of the most active and trusted member of this forum, I have no idea why the fact that he left the forum went unnoticed. Has anyone any idea how is he doing? Is he alive and doing well? Just wondering.Blazed is not a user I know. He is a user who has contributed heavily to the Collections board and to several other boards. Of course that means I never remember if I ever once in a while quoted his post or perhaps asked him something, but I think people may have ignored his inactivity since 2020 because they were busy thinking about themselves.Someone who deals with him frequently might know more about him, but I'm inclined to wonder about TMAN rather than the user you're referring to because of his forum contributions.

comments.author: JeromeTash
comments.body: Hard to know if he is a live or not, but there's also life outside this forum. Even you, a day will come when you log out of this forum for good. In most cases, it will be without any explanation or warning, just like it happened to a number of notable members in the past.So if there was anyone who knew what happened to him, they would have already shared with us in the forum by now

comments.author: LTU_btc
comments.body: I don't really want to speculate about such things. Don't know, maybe there is some people on Bitcointalk who have contact  with him outside forum. But it's quite common thing that famous forum members disappears misteriously. It makes conspiracy theories such like that they passed away. But there is plenty other reasons - family, real life duties, loss of interest in crypto.I don't see any issue that he is still on DT. Fact that he is inactive doesn't makes his feedback irrelevant.

comments.author: The Sceptical Chymist
comments.body: Quote from: Synchronice on September 07, 2023, 03:07:00 PMI was just viewing default trust members on Bitcointalk and suddenly I discovered one ex member called Zepher, he has passed away, RIP. Yep, that was a big deal when it happen, because he was a beloved member of the Collectibles section.  If I recall correctly, his family auctioned off some of his things here after he died; I wanted a keepsake even though I didn't know him, and I have a 100g silver skull that he owned--and some very nice copper commemorative coins that minerjones made.  That really is a tight community.Quote from: Synchronice on September 07, 2023, 03:07:00 PMThen I discovered another member called Blazed. I was wondering the same thing you are a few months ago, because he helped me get on DT2 a few years ago.  It seems strange now because I didn't know him either, but I guess he liked my account seller tagging crusade between 2016-18.There have been quite a few well-known members who've vanished, died, or said sayonara to the forum.  It just happens.

Contributors who leave this forum will be remembered and people will be very curious about what they were doing out there. I'm not sure if Blazed is one of them - but he is an admittedly trustworthy user on Collectibles board.

comments.author: owlcatz
comments.body: You have to look at it all differently to be honest.Some people are definitely still alive, they just either got rich off the last bull run or maybe just found other things like family etc etc... Yes, zepher was a soul of greatness, and I still can't believe it's been almost 5 years, I knew him quite well, we spent time in real life together etc. It was hard accepting his passing as well, due to the short notice after he vanished a few months earlier.  Anyhow, I would not get too deep into this sort of thing - as I said, there are many reasons people leave this forum, intentionally or unintentionally. Why bother? That is 100% their own business. Someday I will leave as well. Will I inform anyone? Maybe, maybe not. Who knows? You see where I'm going right? Let this thread just die in the candle light of the bitcoin warriors who were lucky to be before us here - I think it's for the best.

comments.author: God Of Thunder
comments.body: Blazed apparently lost interest in the forum and became inactive for a long time. Here is a pro tip to understand if they lose interest or not. It does not happen in one day when someone loses interest in something. People slowly lose interest, and they disappear slowly. If you look at his post history, he was pretty active in May 2019, and then he started losing interest in the first week. He made only 23 posts from June 2019 to May 2020. At first, the posting gap starts from a week, then a couple of weeks, and then months! Now, it's been almost three years since he left. If you see someone who is pretty active (Writing posts every day) and suddenly disappears, then there is something to think about.

comments.body: Quote from: LTU_btc on September 07, 2023, 07:23:12 PMBut it's quite common thing that famous forum members disappears misteriously. It makes conspiracy theories such like that they passed away. But there is plenty other reasons - family, real life duties, loss of interest in crypto.Well, as I have commented in another thread, there doesn't seem to be anyone left from the early years on the forum, apart from theymos, and theymos doesn't write much, unlike what he wrote in the early years. They can't all be dead.More likely, I think, is that they lost interest in the forum for some reason or other.Just think, if they did things half right, many would have gotten rich in the early years. Those who mined bitcoin for example with their laptop. Or someone who bought in 2011 at $1, just holding on to the investment until 2013, 14 or 15, where the price traded for hundreds of dollars (peak being $1,237.55), got rich, and lost interest in the forum.

comments.body: Why do we suddenly think someone is dead just because they stopped using Bitcointalk?
